About Me

BIO

I am currently pursuing a bachelors degree in Computer Science and Data Science at University of California, Berkeley. My interests range from Web development, UX/UI design to Machine Learning & AI.

I'm passionate about creating real world applications with intuitive interfaces that people have a pleasant experience using.

TECHNICAL SKILLS

Programming: Java, Python, C++, SQL, PostgreSQL, R, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript,, D3.js, Leaflet
Data Science & Machine Learning: PyTorch, NumPy, Pandas, Seaborn, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn
Databases: MySQL, MongoDB, SQLite, AWS, Kubernetes
PM Methodologies & Data Analytics tools: Agile, Waterfall, Notion, Visio, MS Excel

Software Engineer Intern | CoolClimate Network

Technologies Used: Python, R, SQL, Scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Leaflet

  • Performed Feature-Driven Development (FDD) to develop a consumption-based carbon footprint calculator
  • Collaborated cross-functionally with product design, engineering, and marketing teams to develop smart decision-making tools

Data Science Research Fellow | UC Berkeley

Technologies Used: Java, Python, JavaScript, SQL, Power BI, Agile Methodology, Machine Learning

  • Analyzed large datasets to extract useful insights and develop one-touch applications for addressing public health challenges
  • Developed a smartphone-integrated AI and voice assistant to help 50+ visually impaired sailors in navigating complex paths

Undergraduate Researcher | Stanford School of Medicine

Stanford Center for Asian Health Research

  • Working with medical technology, data science, and Artificial Intelligence to improve the diagnostic process and early prediction of diseases
  • Built an ML Classification model for early diagnosis of Breast Cancer to improve the prognosis and chance of survival
